intro: Chenopodium album subsp. densifoliatum, commonly known as prickly goosefoot, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its dense, lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it is typically found in disturbed soils such as roadsides and fields. It is an annual herb that thrives in temperate climates and is often considered a weed. Its botanical features make it easily identifiable and distinguishable from other species within the Chenopodium genus.
